  • Uses of InHostModelState in io.github.ai4ci.abm.inhost

    Subinterfaces of InHostModelState in io.github.ai4ci.abm.inhost
    Modifier and Type
    Interface
    Description
    interface 
    InHostMarkovState
    A discrete-time Markov chain model of in-host disease and symptom progression.
    interface 
    InHostPhenomenologicalState
    A phenomenological in-host model that tracks viral load and immune activity over time, supporting multiple exposures (e.g., reinfection or vaccination).
    interface 
    InHostStochasticState
    A stochastic difference equation model of in-host viral dynamics and immune response.
    Methods in io.github.ai4ci.abm.inhost that return InHostModelState
    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    static <CFG extends InHostConfiguration>
    InHostModelState<CFG>
    InHostModelState.test(CFG config, ExecutionConfiguration execConfig, Sampler rng)
    Factory method to create a test instance of the in-host model, useful for calibration and debugging.
    default InHostModelState<CFG>
    InHostModelState.update(Person person, Sampler sampler)
    Convenience method to update the in-host state using exposure data from a Person.
    InHostModelState<CFG>
    InHostModelState.update(Sampler sampler, double virionExposure, double immunisationDose)
    Advances the in-host state by one time step, processing new exposures.
